meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unclear or indistinct.
meanings.sent1: The muzziness of the photograph made it hard to recognize the people.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't read the sign due to the muzziness of the letters.
meanings.sent3: The muzziness of the map led us in circles, making us laugh at our confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a fog of muzziness, clouding her recollection of events.
meanings.sent5: The muzziness of the dream left her feeling lost and bewildered.

meanings.definition: A feeling of confusion or disorientation.
meanings.sent1: The loud noises added to the muzziness in my head after the concert.
meanings.sent2: His muzziness about the directions caused him to take the wrong turn.
meanings.sent3: The muzziness in her mind made her accidentally wear mismatched shoes, creating a funny moment.
meanings.sent4: The muzziness in his thoughts was like a thick fog, making it hard for him to make decisions.
meanings.sent5: The muzziness of the situation left everyone feeling lost and unsure of what to do next.
